results.title: Metformin effect in models of inflammation is associated with activation of ATP-dependent potassium channels and inhibition of tumor necrosis factor-alpha production.
results.text_hl: Previous (1 h) per os (p.o.) administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (250, 500 or 1000 mg/kg) inhibited the @DISEASE_Hyperalgesia @DISEASE_MESH:D006930 @@@mechanical allodynia@@@ and paw @DISEASE_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@edema@@@ induced by intraplantar (i.pl.) injection of @CHEMICAL_Carrageenan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002351 @@@carrageenan@@@ (600 mug) and also the @<m>DISEASE_Pleurisy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010998 @@@pleurisy@@@ induced by this stimulus (200 mug, intrapleural).

citations.NLM: Augusto PSA, Matsui TC, Braga AV, Rodrigues FF, Morais MI, Dutra MMGB, Batista CRA, Melo ISF, Costa SOAM, Bertollo CM, Coelho MM, Machado RR. Metformin effect in models of inflammation is associated with activation of ATP-dependent potassium channels and inhibition of tumor necrosis factor-alpha production. Inflammopharmacology. 2022 Feb;30(1):233-241. PMID: 34850313
